adder.description: *(optional)* (GroupedTable) A function that adds a record to the aggregation result

aggregator.description: *(optional)* (GroupedStream, SessionWindowedStream, TimeWindowedStream) The aggregator function, which combines a value with the previous aggregation result and outputs a new aggregation result

initializer.description: The initializer function, which generates an initial value for every set of aggregated records

merger.description: *(optional)* (SessionWindowedStream, SessionWindowedCogroupedStream) A function that combines two aggregation results

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

store.description: Materialized view of the result aggregation

subtractor.description: *(optional)* (GroupedTable) A function that removes a record from the aggregation result

AggregatorDefinition.description: Defines a aggregator function, that gets injected into the Kafka Streams topology

code.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) code of the aggregator.

expression.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) expression returned by the aggregator. Used as an alternative for 'return' statements in the code.

globalCode.description: *(optional)* Global (multiline) code that gets loaded into the Python context outside of the aggregator. Can be used for defining eg. global variables.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the aggregator. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the aggregator

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the aggregator. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

AggregatorDefinition.title: AggregatorDefinition

AggregatorDefinitionWithImplicitStoreTyp.description: Defines a aggregator function, that gets injected into the Kafka Streams topology

code.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) code of the aggregator.

expression.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) expression returned by the aggregator. Used as an alternative for 'return' statements in the code.

globalCode.description: *(optional)* Global (multiline) code that gets loaded into the Python context outside of the aggregator. Can be used for defining eg. global variables.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the aggregator. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the aggregator

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the aggregator. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

AggregatorDefinitionWithImplicitStoreTyp.title: AggregatorDefinitionWithImplicitStoreType

BranchDefinitionWithPipeline.description: Defines a branch with sub-pipeline in a BranchOperation

as.description: *(optional)* The name to register the pipeline result under, which can be used as source by follow-up pipelines

branch.description: *(optional)* Defines a single branch, consisting of a condition and a pipeline to execute for messages that fulfil the predicate

forEach.description: *(optional)* A function that gets called for every message in the stream

if.description: *(optional)* Defines the condition under which messages get sent down this branch

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

print.description: *(optional)* The specification of where to print messages to

to.description: *(optional)* Ends the pipeline by sending all messages to a stream, table or globalTable, or to an inline defined output topic and optional partitioner

toTopicNameExtractor.description: *(optional)* Ends the pipeline by sending all messages to a topic provided by a pre-defined topic name extractor function, or to a topic provided by an inline defined topic name extractor and optional partitioner

via.description: *(optional)* A series of operations performed on the input stream

BranchDefinitionWithPipeline.title: BranchDefinitionWithPipeline

aggregator.description: (GroupedStream, SessionWindowedStream, TimeWindowedStream) The aggregator function, which combines a value with the previous aggregation result and outputs a new aggregation result

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

ConvertKeyOperation.description: An operation to convert the stream key type to another type. Conversion is only syntactic, eg. from Avro to XML.

into.description: The type to convert the stream key into

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

ConvertKeyOperation.title: ConvertKeyOperation

ConvertKeyValueOperation.description: An operation to convert the stream key and value types to other types. Conversion is only syntactic, eg. from Avro to XML.

into.description: The tuple type to convert the stream key/value into

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

ConvertKeyValueOperation.title: ConvertKeyValueOperation

ConvertValueOperation.description: An operation to convert the stream value type to another type. Conversion is only syntactic, eg. from Avro to XML.

into.description: The type to convert the stream value into

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

ConvertValueOperation.title: ConvertValueOperation

CountOperation.description: Count the number of times a key is seen in a given window

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

store.description: *(optional)* Materialized view of the count operation's result

CountOperation.title: CountOperation

FilterNotOperation.description: Filter records based on the inverse result of a predicate function

if.description: A function that returns "false" when records are accepted, "true" otherwise

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

store.description: *(optional)* Materialized view of the filtered table (only applies to tables, ignored for streams)

FilterNotOperation.title: FilterNotOperation

FilterOperation.description: Filter records based on a predicate function

if.description: A function that returns "true" when records are accepted, "false" otherwise

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

store.description: *(optional)* Materialized view of the filtered table (only applies to tables, ignored for streams)

FilterOperation.title: FilterOperation

ForEachActionDefinition.description: Defines a foreach action function, that gets injected into the Kafka Streams topology

code.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) code of the foreach action.

expression.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) expression returned by the foreach action. Used as an alternative for 'return' statements in the code.

globalCode.description: *(optional)* Global (multiline) code that gets loaded into the Python context outside of the foreach action. Can be used for defining eg. global variables.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the foreach action. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the foreach action

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the foreach action. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

stores.description: *(optional)* A list of store names that the foreach action uses. Only required if the function wants to use a state store.

ForEachActionDefinition.title: ForEachActionDefinition

GlobalTableDefinition.description: Contains a definition of a globalTable, which can be referenced by producers and pipelines

keyType.description: *(optional)* The key type of the globalTable

offsetResetPolicy.description: *(optional)* The policy that determines what to do when there is no initial consumer offset in Kafka, or if the message at the committed consumer offset does not exist (e.g. because that data has been deleted)

partitioner.description: *(optional)* A function that determines to which topic partition a given message needs to be written

timestampExtractor.description: *(optional)* A function that extracts the event time from a consumed record

topic.description: The name of the Kafka topic for this globalTable

valueType.description: *(optional)* The value type of the globalTable

GlobalTableDefinition.title: GlobalTableDefinition

valueType.description: *(optional)* The value type of the globalTable

mapper.description: Function to map records to a key they can be grouped on

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

store.description: *(optional)* Materialized view of the grouped stream or table

globalTable.description: A reference to the globalTable, or an inline definition of the globalTable to join with

mapper.description: A function that maps the key value from the stream to the primary key type of the globalTable

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

valueJoiner.description: A function that joins two values

JoinWithGlobalTableOperation.title: JoinWithGlobalTableOperation

JoinWithStreamOperation.description: Operation to join with a stream

grace.description: *(optional)* The window grace period (the time to admit out-of-order events after the end of the window)

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

otherStore.description: Materialized view of the joined stream

stream.description: A reference to the stream, or an inline definition of the stream to join with

thisStore.description: Materialized view of the source stream

timeDifference.description: The maximum time difference for a join over two streams on the same key

valueJoiner.description: A function that joins two values

JoinWithStreamOperation.title: JoinWithStreamOperation

JoinWithTableOperation.description: Operation to join with a table

foreignKeyExtractor.description: *(optional)* A function that can translate the join table value to a primary key

grace.description: *(optional)* The window grace period (the time to admit out-of-order events after the end of the window)

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

otherPartitioner.description: *(optional)* A function that partitions the records on the join table

partitioner.description: *(optional)* A function that partitions the records on the primary table

store.description: *(optional)* Materialized view of the joined table (only used for Table-Table joins)

table.description: A reference to the table, or an inline definition of the table to join with

valueJoiner.description: A function that joins two values

KeyValueStateStoreDefinition.description: Definition of a keyValue state store

caching.description: *(optional)* "true" if changed to the keyValue store need to be buffered and periodically released, "false" to emit all changes directly

historyRetention.description: *(optional)* (Versioned only) The duration for which old record versions are available for query (cannot be negative)

keyType.description: *(optional)* The key type of the keyValue store

logging.description: *(optional)* "true" if a changelog topic should be set up on Kafka for this keyValue store, "false" otherwise

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the keyValue store. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

persistent.description: *(optional)* "true" if this keyValue store needs to be stored on disk, "false" otherwise

segmentInterval.description: *(optional)* Size of segments for storing old record versions (must be positive). Old record versions for the same key in a single segment are stored (updated and accessed) together. The only impact of this parameter is performance. If segments are large and a workload results in many record versions for the same key being collected in a single segment, performance may degrade as a result. On the other hand, historical reads (which access older segments) and out-of-order writes may slow down if there are too many segments.

timestamped.description: *(optional)* "true" if elements in the store are timestamped, "false" otherwise

type.description: The type of the state store

valueType.description: *(optional)* The value type of the keyValue store

versioned.description: *(optional)* "true" if elements in the store are versioned, "false" otherwise

KeyValueStateStoreDefinition.title: KeyValueStateStoreDefinition

If segments are large and a workload results in many record versions for the same key being collected in a single segment, performance may degrade as a result. On the other hand, historical reads (which access older segments) and out-of-order writes may slow down if there are too many segments.

timestamped.description: *(optional)* "true" if elements in the store are timestamped, "false" otherwise

type.description: The type of the state store

KeyValueToValueListTransformerDefinition.description: Defines a keyvalue-to-valuelist transformer function, that gets injected into the Kafka Streams topology

code.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) code of the keyvalue-to-valuelist transformer.

expression.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) expression returned by the keyvalue-to-valuelist transformer. Used as an alternative for 'return' statements in the code.

globalCode.description: *(optional)* Global (multiline) code that gets loaded into the Python context outside of the keyvalue-to-valuelist transformer. Can be used for defining eg. global variables.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the keyvalue-to-valuelist transformer. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the keyvalue-to-valuelist transformer

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the keyvalue-to-valuelist transformer. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

stores.description: *(optional)* A list of store names that the keyvalue-to-valuelist transformer uses. Only required if the function wants to use a state store.

KeyValueToValueListTransformerDefinition.title: KeyValueToValueListTransformerDefinitionWithImplicitStoreType

KeyValueTransformerDefinition.description: Defines a keyvalue transformer function, that gets injected into the Kafka Streams topology

code.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) code of the keyvalue transformer.

expression.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) expression returned by the keyvalue transformer. Used as an alternative for 'return' statements in the code.

globalCode.description: *(optional)* Global (multiline) code that gets loaded into the Python context outside of the keyvalue transformer. Can be used for defining eg. global variables.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the keyvalue transformer. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the keyvalue transformer

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the keyvalue transformer. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

stores.description: *(optional)* A list of store names that the keyvalue transformer uses. Only required if the function wants to use a state store.

KeyValueTransformerDefinition.title: KeyValueTransformerDefinition

KeyValueTransformerDefinitionWithImplici.description: Defines a keyvalue transformer function, that gets injected into the Kafka Streams topology

code.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) code of the keyvalue transformer.

expression.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) expression returned by the keyvalue transformer. Used as an alternative for 'return' statements in the code.

globalCode.description: *(optional)* Global (multiline) code that gets loaded into the Python context outside of the keyvalue transformer. Can be used for defining eg. global variables.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the keyvalue transformer. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the keyvalue transformer

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the keyvalue transformer. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

stores.description: *(optional)* A list of store names that the keyvalue transformer uses. Only required if the function wants to use a state store.

KeyValueTransformerDefinitionWithImplici.title: KeyValueTransformerDefinitionWithImplicitStoreType

LeftJoinWithGlobalTableOperation.description: Operation to leftJoin with a globalTable

globalTable.description: A reference to the globalTable, or an inline definition of the globalTable to join with

mapper.description: A function that maps the key value from the stream with the primary key of the globalTable

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

valueJoiner.description: A function that joins two values

LeftJoinWithGlobalTableOperation.title: LeftJoinWithGlobalTableOperation

LeftJoinWithStreamOperation.description: Operation to leftJoin with a stream

grace.description: *(optional)* The window grace period (the time to admit out-of-order events after the end of the window)

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

otherStore.description: Materialized view of the leftJoined stream

stream.description: A reference to the stream, or an inline definition of the stream to leftJoin with

thisStore.description: Materialized view of the source stream

timeDifference.description: The maximum time difference for a leftJoin over two streams on the same key

valueJoiner.description: A function that joins two values

LeftJoinWithStreamOperation.title: LeftJoinWithStreamOperation

LeftJoinWithTableOperation.description: Operation to leftJoin with a table

foreignKeyExtractor.description: *(optional)* A function that can translate the join table value to a primary key

grace.description: *(optional)* The window grace period (the time to admit out-of-order events after the end of the window)

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

otherPartitioner.description: *(optional)* A function that partitions the records on the join table

partitioner.description: *(optional)* A function that partitions the records on the primary table

store.description: *(optional)* Materialized view of the leftJoined table (only used for Table-Table joins)

table.description: A reference to the table, or an inline definition of the table to join with

valueJoiner.description: A function that joins two values

LeftJoinWithTableOperation.title: LeftJoinWithTableOperation

MergeOperation.description: A merge operation to join two Streams

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

MergeOperation.title: MergeOperation

MergerDefinition.description: Defines a merger function, that gets injected into the Kafka Streams topology

code.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) code of the merger.

expression.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) expression returned by the merger. Used as an alternative for 'return' statements in the code.

globalCode.description: *(optional)* Global (multiline) code that gets loaded into the Python context outside of the merger. Can be used for defining eg. global variables.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the merger. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the merger

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the merger. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

MergerDefinition.title: MergerDefinition

MergerDefinitionWithImplicitStoreType.description: Defines a merger function, that gets injected into the Kafka Streams topology

code.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) code of the merger.

globalCode.description: *(optional)* Global (multiline) code that gets loaded into the Python context outside of the merger. Can be used for defining eg. global variables.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the merger. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the merger

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the merger. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

MetadataTransformerDefinition.description: Defines a metadata transformer function, that gets injected into the Kafka Streams topology

code.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) code of the metadata transformer.

expression.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) expression returned by the metadata transformer. Used as an alternative for 'return' statements in the code.

globalCode.description: *(optional)* Global (multiline) code that gets loaded into the Python context outside of the metadata transformer. Can be used for defining eg. global variables.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the metadata transformer. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the metadata transformer

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the metadata transformer. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

stores.description: *(optional)* A list of store names that the metadata transformer uses. Only required if the function wants to use a state store.

MetadataTransformerDefinition.title: MetadataTransformerDefinition

MetadataTransformerDefinitionWithImplici.description: Defines a metadata transformer function, that gets injected into the Kafka Streams topology

code.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) code of the metadata transformer.

expression.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) expression returned by the metadata transformer. Used as an alternative for 'return' statements in the code.

globalCode.description: *(optional)* Global (multiline) code that gets loaded into the Python context outside of the metadata transformer. Can be used for defining eg. global variables.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the metadata transformer. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the metadata transformer

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the metadata transformer. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

MetadataTransformerDefinitionWithImplici.title: MetadataTransformerDefinitionWithImplicitStoreType

OuterJoinWithStreamOperation.description: Operation to outerJoin with a stream

grace.description: *(optional)* The window grace period (the time to admit out-of-order events after the end of the window)

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

otherStore.description: Materialized view of the outerJoined stream

stream.description: A reference to the stream, or an inline definition of the stream to outerJoin with

thisStore.description: Materialized view of the source stream

timeDifference.description: The maximum time difference for an outerJoin over two streams on the same key

valueJoiner.description: A function that joins two values

OuterJoinWithStreamOperation.title: OuterJoinWithStreamOperation

OuterJoinWithTableOperation.description: Operation to outerJoin with a table

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

store.description: *(optional)* Materialized view of the outerJoined table

table.description: A reference to the table, or an inline definition of the table to outerJoin with

valueJoiner.description: A function that joins two values

OuterJoinWithTableOperation.title: OuterJoinWithTableOperation

ParameterDefinition.description: Defines a parameter for a user function

defaultValue.description: *(optional)* The default value for the parameter

name.description: The name of the parameter

ParameterDefinition.title: ParameterDefinition

PeekOperation.description: Operation to peek into a stream, without modifying the stream contents

forEach.description: A function that gets called for every message in the stream

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

PeekOperation.title: PeekOperation

PipelineDefinition.description: Defines a pipeline through a source, a series of operations to perform on it and a sink operation to close the stream with

as.description: *(optional)* The name to register the pipeline result under, which can be used as source by follow-up pipelines

branch.description: *(optional)* Defines a single branch, consisting of a condition and a pipeline to execute for messages that fulfil the predicate

forEach.description: *(optional)* A function that gets called for every message in the stream

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

print.description: *(optional)* The specification of where to print messages to

to.description: *(optional)* Ends the pipeline by sending all messages to a stream, table or globalTable, or to an inline defined output topic and optional partitioner

toTopicNameExtractor.description: *(optional)* Ends the pipeline by sending all messages to a topic provided by a pre-defined topic name extractor function, or to a topic provided by an inline defined topic name extractor and optional partitioner

via.description: *(optional)* A series of operations performed on the input stream

PipelineDefinition.title: PipelineDefinition

PredicateDefinition.description: Defines a predicate function, that gets injected into the Kafka Streams topology

code.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) code of the predicate.

expression.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) expression returned by the predicate. Used as an alternative for 'return' statements in the code.

globalCode.description: *(optional)* Global (multiline) code that gets loaded into the Python context outside of the predicate. Can be used for defining eg. global variables.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the predicate. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the predicate

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the predicate. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

stores.description: *(optional)* A list of store names that the predicate uses. Only required if the function wants to use a state store.

PredicateDefinition.title: PredicateDefinition

PredicateDefinitionWithImplicitStoreType.description: Defines a predicate function, that gets injected into the Kafka Streams topology

code.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) code of the predicate.

expression.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) expression returned by the predicate. Used as an alternative for 'return' statements in the code.

globalCode.description: *(optional)* Global (multiline) code that gets loaded into the Python context outside of the predicate. Can be used for defining eg. global variables.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the predicate. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the predicate

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the predicate. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

stores.description: *(optional)* A list of store names that the predicate uses. Only required if the function wants to use a state store.

PredicateDefinitionWithImplicitStoreType.title: PredicateDefinitionWithImplicitStoreType

PrintOperation.description: Operation to print the contents of a pipeline on the screen or to write them to a file

filename.description: *(optional)* The filename to output records to. If nothing is specified, then messages will be printed on stdout.

label.description: *(optional)* A label to attach to the output records

mapper.description: *(optional)* A function to convert record into a string for output

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

PrintOperation.title: PrintOperation

ProducerDefinition.description: Definition of a Producer that regularly generates messages for a topic

condition.description: *(optional)* A function that validates the generator's result message. Returns "true" when the message may be produced on the topic, "false" otherwise.

count.description: *(optional)* The number of messages to produce.

interval.description: *(optional)* The interval with which the generator is called

until.description: *(optional)* A predicate that returns true to indicate producing should stop.

ProducerDefinition.title: ProducerDefinition

ReduceOperationWithAdderAndSubtractor.description: Operation to reduce a series of records into a single aggregate result

adder.description: A function that adds a record to the aggregate result

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

subtractor.description: A function that removes a record from the aggregate result

ReduceOperationWithAdderAndSubtractor.title: ReduceOperationWithAdderAndSubtractor

ReduceOperationWithReducer.description: Operation to reduce a series of records into a single aggregate result

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

reducer.description: A function that computes a new aggregate result

ReduceOperationWithReducer.title: ReduceOperationWithReducer

ReducerDefinition.description: Defines a reducer function, that gets injected into the Kafka Streams topology

code.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) code of the reducer.

expression.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) expression returned by the reducer. Used as an alternative for 'return' statements in the code.

globalCode.description: *(optional)* Global (multiline) code that gets loaded into the Python context outside of the reducer. Can be used for defining eg. global variables.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the reducer. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the reducer

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the reducer. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

ReducerDefinition.title: ReducerDefinition

ReducerDefinitionWithImplicitStoreType.description: Defines a reducer function, that gets injected into the Kafka Streams topology

globalCode.description: *(optional)* Global (multiline) code that gets loaded into the Python context outside of the reducer. Can be used for defining eg. global variables.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the reducer. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the reducer

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the reducer. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

ReducerDefinitionWithImplicitStoreType.title: ReducerDefinitionWithImplicitStoreType

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

partitioner.description: *(optional)* A function that partitions stream records

SessionStateStoreDefinition.description: Definition of a session state store

caching.description: *(optional)* "true" if changed to the session store need to be buffered and periodically released, "false" to emit all changes directly

keyType.description: The key type of the session store

logging.description: *(optional)* "true" if a changelog topic should be set up on Kafka for this session store, "false" otherwise

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the session store. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

persistent.description: *(optional)* "true" if this session store needs to be stored on disk, "false" otherwise

retention.description: *(optional)* The duration for which elements in the session store are retained

timestamped.description: *(optional)* "true" if elements in the store are timestamped, "false" otherwise

type.description: The type of the state store

valueType.description: The value type of the session store

SessionStateStoreDefinition.title: SessionStateStoreDefinition

SessionStateStoreDefinitionWithImplicitK.description: Definition of a session state store

caching.description: *(optional)* "true" if changed to the session store need to be buffered and periodically released, "false" to emit all changes directly

logging.description: *(optional)* "true" if a changelog topic should be set up on Kafka for this session store, "false" otherwise

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the session store. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

persistent.description: *(optional)* "true" if this session store needs to be stored on disk, "false" otherwise

retention.description: *(optional)* The duration for which elements in the session store are retained

timestamped.description: *(optional)* "true" if elements in the store are timestamped, "false" otherwise

type.description: The type of the state store

StreamDefinition.description: Contains a definition of a Stream, which can be referenced by producers and pipelines

keyType.description: The key type of the stream

offsetResetPolicy.description: *(optional)* Policy that determines what to do when there is no initial offset in Kafka, or if the current offset does not exist any more on the server (e.g. because that data has been deleted)

partitioner.description: *(optional)* A function that determines to which topic partition a given message needs to be written

timestampExtractor.description: *(optional)* A function extracts the event time from a consumed record

topic.description: The name of the Kafka topic for this stream

valueType.description: The value type of the stream

StreamDefinition.title: StreamDefinition

StreamDefinitionAsJoinTarget.description: Reference to a Stream in a join or merge operation

keyType.description: *(optional)* The key type of the stream

topic.description: The name of the Kafka topic for this stream

valueType.description: *(optional)* The value type of the stream

StreamDefinitionAsJoinTarget.title: StreamDefinitionAsJoinTarget

StreamPartitionerDefinition.description: Defines a stream partitioner function, that gets injected into the Kafka Streams topology

code.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) code of the stream partitioner.

expression.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) expression returned by the stream partitioner. Used as an alternative for 'return' statements in the code.

globalCode.description: *(optional)* Global (multiline) code that gets loaded into the Python context outside of the stream partitioner. Can be used for defining eg. global variables.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the stream partitioner. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the stream partitioner

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the stream partitioner. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

StreamPartitionerDefinition.title: StreamPartitionerDefinition

globalCode.description: *(optional)* Global (multiline) code that gets loaded into the Python context outside of the stream partitioner. Can be used for defining eg. global variables.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the stream partitioner. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the stream partitioner

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the stream partitioner. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

SuppressOperationUntilTimeLimit.description: Operation to suppress messages in the source stream until a time limit is reached

bufferFullStrategy.description: *(optional)* What to do when the buffer is full

duration.description: The duration for which messages are suppressed

maxBytes.description: *(optional)* The maximum number of bytes in the buffer

maxRecords.description: *(optional)* The maximum number of records in the buffer

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

until.description: The until of the Operation to suppress messages in the source stream until a certain limit is reached

SuppressOperationUntilTimeLimit.title: SuppressOperationUntilTimeLimit

SuppressOperationUntilWindowCloses.description: Operation to suppress messages in the source stream until a window limit is reached

bufferFullStrategy.description: *(optional)* What to do when the buffer is full

maxBytes.description: *(optional)* The maximum number of bytes in the buffer

maxRecords.description: *(optional)* The maximum number of records in the buffer

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

until.description: The until of the Operation to suppress messages in the source stream until a certain limit is reached

SuppressOperationUntilWindowCloses.title: SuppressOperationUntilWindowCloses

TableDefinition.description: Contains a definition of a table, which can be referenced by producers and pipelines

keyType.description: *(optional)* The key type of the table

offsetResetPolicy.description: *(optional)* The policy that determines what to do when there is no initial consumer offset in Kafka, or if the message at the committed consumer offset does not exist (e.g. because that data has been deleted)

partitioner.description: *(optional)* A function that determines to which topic partition a given message needs to be written

timestampExtractor.description: *(optional)* A function that extracts the event time from a consumed record

topic.description: The name of the Kafka topic for this table

valueType.description: *(optional)* The value type of the table

TableDefinition.title: TableDefinition

valueType.description: *(optional)* The value type of the table

TimestampExtractorDefinition.description: Defines a timestamp extractor function, that gets injected into the Kafka Streams topology

code.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) code of the timestamp extractor.

expression.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) expression returned by the timestamp extractor. Used as an alternative for 'return' statements in the code.

globalCode.description: *(optional)* Global (multiline) code that gets loaded into the Python context outside of the timestamp extractor. Can be used for defining eg. global variables.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the timestamp extractor. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the timestamp extractor

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the timestamp extractor. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the timestamp extractor. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the timestamp extractor

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the timestamp extractor. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

TransformKeyOperation.description: Convert the key of every record in the stream to another key

mapper.description: A function that computes a new key for each record

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

TransformKeyOperation.title: TransformKeyOperation

TransformKeyValueOperation.description: Convert the key/value of every record in the stream to another key/value

mapper.description: A function that computes a new key/value for each record

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

TransformKeyValueOperation.title: TransformKeyValueOperation

TransformKeyValueToKeyValueListOperation.description: Convert a stream by transforming every record into a list of derived records

mapper.description: A function that converts every record of a stream to a list of output records.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

TransformKeyValueToKeyValueListOperation.title: TransformKeyValueToKeyValueListOperation

TransformKeyValueToValueListOperation.description: Convert every record in the stream to a list of output records with the same key

mapper.description: A function that converts every key/value into a list of result values, each of which will be combined with the original key to form a new message in the output stream

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

TransformKeyValueToValueListOperation.title: TransformKeyValueToValueListOperation

TransformMetadataOperation.description: Convert the metadata of every record in the stream

mapper.description: A function that converts the metadata (Kafka headers, timestamp) of every record in the stream

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

TransformMetadataOperation.title: TransformMetadataOperation

TransformValueOperation.description: Convert the value of every record in the stream to another value

mapper.description: A function that converts the value of every record into another value

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

store.description: *(optional)* Materialized view of the transformed table (only applies to tables, ignored for streams)

TransformValueOperation.title: TransformValueOperation

ValueJoinerDefinition.description: Defines a value joiner function, that gets injected into the Kafka Streams topology

code.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) code of the value joiner.

expression.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) expression returned by the value joiner. Used as an alternative for 'return' statements in the code.

globalCode.description: *(optional)* Global (multiline) code that gets loaded into the Python context outside of the value joiner. Can be used for defining eg. global variables.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the value joiner. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the value joiner

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the value joiner. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

ValueJoinerDefinition.title: ValueJoinerDefinition

ValueJoinerDefinitionWithImplicitStoreTy.description: Defines a value joiner function, that gets injected into the Kafka Streams topology

code.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) code of the value joiner.

expression.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) expression returned by the value joiner. Used as an alternative for 'return' statements in the code.

globalCode.description: *(optional)* Global (multiline) code that gets loaded into the Python context outside of the value joiner. Can be used for defining eg. global variables.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the value joiner. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the value joiner

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the value joiner. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

ValueJoinerDefinitionWithImplicitStoreTy.title: ValueJoinerDefinitionWithImplicitStoreType

ValueTransformerDefinition.description: Defines a value transformer function, that gets injected into the Kafka Streams topology

code.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) code of the value transformer.

expression.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) expression returned by the value transformer. Used as an alternative for 'return' statements in the code.

globalCode.description: *(optional)* Global (multiline) code that gets loaded into the Python context outside of the value transformer. Can be used for defining eg. global variables.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the value transformer. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the value transformer

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the value transformer. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

stores.description: *(optional)* A list of store names that the value transformer uses. Only required if the function wants to use a state store.

ValueTransformerDefinition.title: ValueTransformerDefinition

ValueTransformerDefinitionWithImplicitSt.description: Defines a value transformer function, that gets injected into the Kafka Streams topology

code.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) code of the value transformer.

expression.description: *(optional)* The (multiline) expression returned by the value transformer. Used as an alternative for 'return' statements in the code.

globalCode.description: *(optional)* Global (multiline) code that gets loaded into the Python context outside of the value transformer. Can be used for defining eg. global variables.

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the value transformer. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

parameters.description: *(optional)* A list of parameters to be passed into the value transformer

resultType.description: *(optional)* The data type returned by the value transformer. Only required for function types, which are not pre-defined.

stores.description: *(optional)* A list of store names that the value transformer uses. Only required if the function wants to use a state store.

ValueTransformerDefinitionWithImplicitSt.title: ValueTransformerDefinitionWithImplicitStoreType

WindowBySessionOperation.description: Operation to window messages by session, configured by an inactivity gap

grace.description: *(optional)* (Tumbling, Hopping) The grace period, during which out-of-order records can still be processed

inactivityGap.description: The inactivity gap, below which two messages are considered to be of the same session

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

WindowBySessionOperation.title: WindowBySessionOperation

WindowByTimeOperationWithHoppingWindow.description: Operation to window records based on time criteria

advanceBy.description: The amount of time to increase time windows by

grace.description: *(optional)* The grace period, during which out-of-order records can still be processed

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

windowType.description: The windowType of the time window

WindowByTimeOperationWithHoppingWindow.title: WindowByTimeOperationWithHoppingWindow

WindowByTimeOperationWithSlidingWindow.description: Operation to window records based on time criteria

grace.description: *(optional)* The grace period, during which out-of-order records can still be processed

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

timeDifference.description: The maximum amount of time difference between two records

windowType.description: The windowType of the time window

WindowByTimeOperationWithSlidingWindow.title: WindowByTimeOperationWithSlidingWindow

WindowByTimeOperationWithTumblingWindow.description: Operation to window records based on time criteria

grace.description: *(optional)* The grace period, during which out-of-order records can still be processed

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the operation processor

windowType.description: The windowType of the time window

WindowByTimeOperationWithTumblingWindow.title: WindowByTimeOperationWithTumblingWindow

WindowStateStoreDefinition.description: Definition of a window state store

caching.description: *(optional)* "true" if changed to the window store need to be buffered and periodically released, "false" to emit all changes directly

keyType.description: The key type of the window store

logging.description: *(optional)* "true" if a changelog topic should be set up on Kafka for this window store, "false" otherwise

name.description: *(optional)* The name of the window store. If this field is not defined, then the name is derived from the context.

persistent.description: *(optional)* "true" if this window store needs to be stored on disk, "false" otherwise

retainDuplicates.description: *(optional)* Whether or not to retain duplicates

retention.description: *(optional)* The duration for which elements in the window store are retained

timestamped.description: *(optional)* "true" if elements in the store are timestamped, "false" otherwise

type.description: The type of the state store

valueType.description: The value type of the window store

windowSize.description: *(optional)* Size of the windows (cannot be negative)

WindowStateStoreDefinition.title: WindowStateStoreDefinition

retention.description: *(optional)* The duration for which elements in the window store are retained

timestamped.description: *(optional)* "true" if elements in the store are timestamped, "false" otherwise

type.description: The type of the state store

windowSize.description: *(optional)* Size of the windows (cannot be negative)

functions.description: *(optional)* Functions that can be referenced in producers and pipelines

globalTables.description: *(optional)* GlobalTables that can be referenced in producers and pipelines

stores.description: *(optional)* State stores that can be referenced in producers and pipelines

streams.description: *(optional)* Streams that can be referenced in producers and pipelines

tables.description: *(optional)* Tables that can be referenced in producers and pipelines
